communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Internal mail theft in Detroit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any record—including emails, reports, contents of hotline calls, investigation reports, internal memos, complaints submitted to the OIG or bulletins the OIG has distributed—pertaining to internal mail theft believed to be occurring in Detroit, Michigan between the dates of April 1, 2022 and August 1, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Laura Herberg

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: City contracts/agreements with fiscal intermediaries
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all contracts and/or grant agreements between City of Detroit departments or budgeted units, and fiscal sponsors (which are sometimes also referred to as fiscal intermediaries or nonprofit fiduciaries) since 2018.  

For context, Office of Chief Financial Officer Communications Manager Stephanie Davis said a nonprofit fiduciary is a philanthropic group city departments use to send funds for a particular initiative or purpose. Those funds are tied to a grant agreement outlining the duration, terms, etc. of the work. 

For example, the Mayor's Office-Mobility uses Eastside Community Network as a fiscal sponsor.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Laura Herberg
